intro: Aureolaria villosa, commonly known as downy auricle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae), characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant has compound leaves with small, hairy stipules and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a tendency to form dense, low-growing mats. Aureolaria villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
